snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Wednesday, selections include a developer who hired a Chinese company to do his job so he could surf cyberspace, a pessimistic look at...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Wednesday, selections include a developer who hired a Chinese company to do his job so he could surf cyberspace, a pessimistic look at imminent technology earnings and a privacy guide for the new Facebook search tool.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Walmart's Phone Asterisk and Tech Money Stories
